ground_truth: He reaches for the script. Harry backs away, holds the script to his chest. Bo Catlett notices this. Bo Catlett eyes him a beat, then pushes out of his chair. Bo Catlett nods, gets up. Ronnie sits up straight. Ronnie opens his coat so that Harry can see a gun tucked in his belt. Bo Catlett gives Ronnie a look. Bo Catlett glances once more at Chili then follows Ronnie out the door. Harry stares at the door a moment, senses Chili staring at him. Chili looks at Harry. Chili shakes his head as Harry sits down in one of the chairs, fumbles for his cigarettes. Chili's minivan is parked out front. Obviously losing it now, rubs his eyes and quickly walks off to a row of payphones. Chili sits at the desk on the phone. They consider each other a moment until Chili finally checks his watch. Karen looks caught, doesn't answer right away. Chili lets that sink in a minute. Leo sits down in the armchair, stares sadly at the briefcase. Leo nods. He picks up the briefcase as he rises from the sofa and Leo gets out of his chair. Chili reaches for the door, opens it and looks back at Leo. As Chili starts for the elevator. Chili drives a dark road up into the park. Chili pulls in behind a row of trailers. He gets out of the car and heads for the set where Harry is now looking up at the sky and yelling at someone. He rounds a corner, and we see an explosion of light up ahead as we come upon. As he starts back, he sees Leo's scared look just before he slams the door shut. Leo steps into his doorway. Chili shakes his head, starts back for the elevator. Chili stops, turns around. Chili says nothing, sits down in one of the red leather chairs. Bo Catlett smiles at him, doesn't give up the script. Bo watches as Chili picks up a copy of the script, begins flipping through it. Chili flips through the script, sees a name. Karen smiles, decides to wait a moment. Chili, lost in the movie, keeps mouthing the dialogue. As Tanya/Marlene Dietrich resumes her slow walk away, Karen sits down at the end of the row. People start getting up to leave. Chili turns to a guy a few seats away from him. The guy gives Chili a look, puts his arm around his date, and quickly starts up the aisle so that Chili can now see Karen sitting there at the end of the row. She gets up, they start up the aisle together. As Karen and Chili exit the theater, stand there a moment.

Bo Catlett nods, stands up. Ronnie sits up straight. Ronnie opens his jacket so that Harry can see a firearm tucked in his waistband. Bo Catlett gives Ronnie a glance. Bo Catlett glances once more at Chili then trails Ronnie out the door. Harry stares at the door a moment, senses Chili gazing at him. Chili looks at Harry. Chili shakes his head as Harry sits down in one of the chairs, fumbles for his cigarettes. Chili's minivan is parked out front. Bo watches as Chili picks up a copy of the screenplay, begins flipping through it. Chili flips through the screenplay, sees a name. Karen smiles, decides to wait a moment. Chili, engrossed in the film, keeps mouthing the dialogue. As Tanya/Marlene Dietrich resumes her slow walk away, Karen sits down at the end of the row. People start getting up to leave. test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: He reaches for the script, and Harry backs away, holding it to his chest. Bo Catlett notices and, nodding, rises from his chair. Ronnie sits up, revealing a gun in his coat. Bo glances at Ronnie and follows him out. Harry stares at the door, aware of Chili's gaze. Chili shakes his head as Harry sits, fumbling for cigarettes. Chili's minivan is parked outside. Losing composure, Harry rubs his eyes and hurries to payphones. Chili, on the phone, watches him. They exchange looks until Chili checks his watch. Karen feels caught but stays silent. Leo sits sadly with a briefcase, nodding as he rises. Chili reaches for the door, glancing back at Leo before heading to the elevator. He drives to the park, stops near trailers, and approaches the set where Harry yells at someone. Seeing an explosion of light, Chili moves back and notices Leo's frightened look before slamming a door. Leo steps into his doorway as Chili shakes his head and returns to the elevator. Chili sits in a red leather chair, while Bo smiles and keeps the script. Bo observes as Chili flips through the script and finds a name. Karen waits, and Chili, absorbed in the movie, mouths dialogue. As Tanya/Marlene Dietrich walks away, Karen sits at the row's end. People leave, and Chili looks at a nearby guy, who quickly leaves with his date, revealing Karen. She stands, and they exit the theater together, pausing outside.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: He reaches for the script. Harry backs away, holding it to his chest. Bo Catlett notices, eyes him, nods, and stands. Ronnie reveals a gun in his belt. Bo glances at Chili, then follows Ronnie out. Harry senses Chili staring. Chili shakes his head as Harry sits and fumbles for cigarettes. Outside, Chili's minivan is parked. Losing it, Harry walks to payphones. Chili phones inside, checks his watch. Karen looks caught. Leo, saddened, nods, picks up his briefcase, and stands. Chili reaches for the door, looks back at Leo, heads for the elevator, and drives a dark road to the set. He sees Harry yelling and an explosion of light. Leo appears scared as he closes the door. Chili heads back, sits in a red chair. Bo smiles, keeps the script. Chili flips through it, sees a name. Karen smiles, waits. Chili mouths dialogue as people leave the theater. Chili sees Karen, and they exit together, standing briefly outside.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
He slowly extends his hand towards the script, a cautious move that doesn't go unnoticed. Harry, feeling protective, takes a step back and clutches the script tightly against his chest. Bo Catlett observes this interaction with keen interest. After a brief pause, Bo Catlett rises from his chair. With a slight nod, he stands up. Meanwhile, Ronnie straightens his posture, adopting a more assertive position. He unbuttons his coat to deliberately reveal a gun nestled securely in his belt for Harry to see. This action draws a significant look from Bo Catlett, who then glances at Chili one last time before trailing after Ronnie as they make their way out the door. Harry is left staring at the door, lost in thought, aware of Chili’s gaze fixed on him. Chili, observing Harry, slowly shakes his head in disapproval as Harry lowers himself into one of the nearby chairs and awkwardly reaches for his pack of cigarettes. Outside, Chili's minivan is conspicuously parked at the front. Clearly unraveling under pressure, Harry rubs his eyes and swiftly heads towards a row of payphones. 

Chili, meanwhile, is seated at a desk, engaged in a phone conversation. The two exchange a momentary look of consideration until Chili finally checks the time on his watch. Karen, appearing caught off guard, hesitates before responding. Chili allows the statement to linger for a moment, letting the implication settle in. Leo then sinks sadly into the armchair, fixating on the briefcase with a somber expression. He gives a nod of acknowledgment. Rising from the sofa, he picks up the briefcase, and while Leo stands up from his chair, Chili moves towards the door, opens it, and glances back at Leo. As Chili begins his way to the elevator, he drives through the dark road leading into the park. Upon reaching the location, he pulls in and parks behind a line of trailers. Exiting the car, he strides towards the film set where Harry is now, directing his gaze skyward, shouting at someone unseen. As Chili rounds a corner, an explosion of bright light bursts ahead in their vision. Upon returning, he notices Leo’s frightened expression just before Leo hurriedly closes the door. Leo then steps back into his doorway. With a shake of his head, Chili turns and heads back towards the elevator. He pauses, pivots on his heel. Remaining silent, Chili settles into one of the plush red leather chairs. Bo Catlett offers him a smile but maintains his grip on the script, not relenting. Bo watches intently as Chili picks up another copy of the script, casually flipping through its pages. As he does so, Chili spots a familiar name, an intriguing discovery. 

Karen, observing from nearby, smiles to herself and decides to hold off for a few moments. Chili, engrossed in the unfolding movie, quietly mouths the dialogue. As the scene with Tanya/Marlene Dietrich progresses in her slow, deliberate walk away, Karen takes a seat at the very end of the row. Gradually, people start to rise, preparing to leave the theater. Chili turns his attention to a man seated a few spots away from him. The man casts a glance at Chili, wraps his arm around his date, and hurriedly makes his way up the aisle, allowing Chili a clearer view of Karen, who is positioned at the end of the row. She stands, and together, they begin their ascent up the aisle. As Karen and Chili exit the theater, they pause momentarily, standing in thoughtful silence.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
He deliberately and cautiously extends his hand in the direction of the script, a careful gesture that certainly does not escape notice. Feeling an instinct to protect what is his, Harry takes a wary step backward and clutches the script closely and securely against his chest. This interaction is observed by Bo Catlett with a keen and vested interest. After a momentary pause, Bo Catlett slowly rises from his seat, offering a slight nod as he gets to his feet. Concurrently, Ronnie straightens his posture, adopting a more assertive and bold stance. He deliberately unbuttons his coat to reveal a gun nestled securely in his belt, making sure Harry can see it. This decisive action draws a significant and thoughtful glance from Bo Catlett, who then gives Chili one last look before following Ronnie out the door. Harry is left standing there, his gaze firmly fixed on the door, lost in thought, fully aware of Chili’s disappointed gaze fixed on him. Watching Harry, Chili slowly shakes his head in disapproval while Harry awkwardly lowers himself into one of the nearby chairs and reaches for his pack of cigarettes in an uncomfortable manner. Outside, Chili's minivan is conspicuously parked right at the front. Clearly feeling the pressure, Harry rubs his eyes in frustration before swiftly making his way towards a row of nearby payphones.

Meanwhile, Chili is seated at a desk, fully engaged in a phone conversation. The two of them share a brief, momentary look of consideration until Chili finally checks the time on his watch, as if noting the passage of time. Karen, appearing somewhat caught off guard, hesitates briefly before she responds. Chili allows the statement to linger in the air for a moment, letting its full implication settle in the room. Leo then sinks sadly into the armchair, his expression somber as he fixates on the briefcase in front of him. He gives a subtle nod of acknowledgment. Rising slowly from the sofa, he picks up the briefcase, and while Leo stands up from his chair, Chili moves purposefully towards the door, opens it, and glances back one last time at Leo. As Chili begins his way towards the elevator, he drives through the dark road leading into the park. Upon arriving at the location, he pulls in and parks behind a neat line of trailers. Exiting his car, he strides purposefully towards the film set where Harry is currently situated, directing his gaze skyward and shouting at someone unseen. As Chili rounds a particular corner, an explosion of bright light bursts ahead in his vision. Upon returning, he notices Leo’s expression of fear just before Leo hurriedly closes the door. Leo then steps back into the doorway, looking unsettled. With a resigned shake of his head, Chili turns and heads back to the elevator. He pauses, pivots on his heel, and then, remaining silent, settles into one of the plush red leather chairs. Bo Catlett offers him a smile but continues to maintain his firm grip on the script, showing no sign of relenting. Bo watches intently as Chili nonchalantly picks up another copy of the script, casually flipping through its pages. While doing so, Chili spots a familiar name, making an intriguing discovery.

Nearby, Karen observes this scene and smiles quietly to herself, deciding to hold off for a few more moments. Chili, thoroughly engrossed in the unfolding movie scene, quietly mouths the dialogue as it progresses. As Tanya's, or Marlene Dietrich's, scene advances with her slow, deliberate walk away, Karen moves and takes a seat at the far end of the row. Gradually, people begin to rise from their seats, preparing to leave the theater. Chili shifts his attention to a man seated a few spots away from him. The man casts a quick glance at Chili, wraps his arm protectively around his date, and hurriedly makes his way up the aisle, which allows Chili a clearer view of Karen, who is positioned at the end of the row. She stands, and together, they begin their ascent up the aisle. As Karen and Chili exit the theater, they pause momentarily, standing together in thoughtful and contemplative silence.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: He reaches out with his hand, intending to grasp the script, when Harry instinctively retreats, tightening his grip and pressing the script protectively against his chest. Bo Catlett takes notice of this subtle yet telling gesture. Observing the situation with a keen eye, Bo Catlett fixes his gaze on Harry for a moment, then decisively rises from his chair. With a nod, Bo Catlett stands, prompting Ronnie to react by straightening his posture. Ronnie, in a calculated move, slips open his coat just enough to reveal the gun nestled in his belt, making sure Harry sees it. Bo Catlett exchanges a knowing glance with Ronnie, casting a final look at Chili before trailing Ronnie out through the door. Left behind, Harry fixes his eyes on the door for a moment, acutely aware of Chili's stare fixed upon him. As Chili turns his gaze on Harry, he shakes his head silently in disapproval while Harry settles into one of the available chairs, his hands awkwardly reaching for his cigarettes. Outside, parked conspicuously, sits Chili's minivan. Feeling his composure slipping away, Harry rubs his eyes in frustration and swiftly moves toward a row of payphones nearby. Meanwhile, Chili is seated at a desk, engaged in conversation over the phone, their eyes meeting briefly across the distance, each silently assessing the other until Chili breaks the gaze to check his watch. Karen, caught off guard, hesitates in her response, and Chili allows the pause to linger, letting its weight sink in. In a different scene, Leo lowers himself into an armchair, casting a sorrowful glance at the briefcase beside him. He nods solemnly, then, with a purposeful motion, retrieves the briefcase as he stands from the sofa, and Leo rises from his chair in tandem. Approaching the door, Chili extends his hand, opens it, and glances back at Leo, then proceeds toward the elevator. The scene shifts as Chili drives along a shadowy road leading up to the park, maneuvering his car to a stop behind a row of trailers. Exiting the vehicle, he strides purposefully toward the set, where Harry, looking skyward, is engaged in a loud exchange with someone. Rounding a corner, there is a sudden burst of light illuminating the path ahead. As Chili begins to make his way back, he catches sight of Leo's frightened expression just moments before the door slams shut. Leo steps into the doorway, prompting Chili to shake his head and turn back toward the elevator. He halts, pivots, and without uttering a word, sinks into one of the plush red leather chairs. Bo Catlett offers him a grin, withholding the script tightly. Bo watches intently as Chili picks up a copy of the script and begins to leaf through its pages. As Chili skims through, a name catches his attention. Karen, observing him, holds her smile, opting to linger for a moment longer. Deeply absorbed in the movie, Chili mouths the lines silently along with the characters. As Tanya, portrayed by Marlene Dietrich, resumes her slow, deliberate walk away, Karen takes her seat at the far end of the row. As the film concludes, the audience begins to rise and make their way out, leaving Chili to turn to a man seated a few spots away. The man, noting Chili's gaze, casts a look of acknowledgement, wraps an arm around his companion, and quickly moves up the aisle, clearing Chili's view to reveal Karen seated at the row's end. Rising to her feet, she and Chili begin ascending the aisle side by side. As they exit the theater, they pause momentarily, standing together in the afterglow of the cinematic experience.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Harry clutches the script protectively as Bo Catlett notices and rises from his chair, exchanging a glance with Ronnie, who subtly reveals a gun in his belt. Bo and Ronnie leave, with Harry and Chili exchanging looks before Harry settles into a chair, searching for his cigarettes. Outside, Chili's minivan is parked, and he walks to a row of payphones, visibly anxious. Meanwhile, inside, Chili concludes a phone call and checks his watch, while Karen hesitates to respond to him. Leo, looking forlorn, rises with a briefcase after nodding at Chili, who opens the door and heads for the elevator. Later, Chili drives to a film set in the park, arriving as Harry is yelling at someone. After witnessing an explosion of light from a distance, Chili sees Leo's frightened expression before Leo shuts the door. Back at the theater, Chili peruses the script Bo had been holding, notices a name, and becomes engrossed in the movie, mouthing the dialogue. As the film ends and people begin to leave, Karen waits until Chili notices her, and together they exit the theater, pausing momentarily outside.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: He reaches for the script, a key document for the upcoming Hollywood film they are working on. Harry backs away, holds the script to his chest, knowing the importance of the screenplay's confidentiality. Bo Catlett, a seasoned producer with a reputation for being persuasive, notices this. Bo Catlett eyes him a beat, then pushes out of his chair, which is part of his signature style of asserting dominance in negotiations. Bo Catlett nods, gets up. Ronnie, known for his intimidating presence, sits up straight. Ronnie opens his coat so that Harry can see a gun tucked in his belt, a reminder of the high stakes involved in the movie industry, where money often attracts danger. Bo Catlett gives Ronnie a look, a silent communication between two men familiar with this kind of tension. Bo Catlett glances once more at Chili, a well-regarded fixer in the film business, then follows Ronnie out the door. Harry stares at the door a moment, senses Chili staring at him, a man known for his ability to read others. Chili looks at Harry. Chili shakes his head as Harry sits down in one of the chairs, fumbles for his cigarettes, a habit he's picked up during stressful meetings. Chili's minivan, a trusted vehicle for his line of work, is parked out front. Obviously losing it now, Harry rubs his eyes and quickly walks off to a row of payphones, a relic in the age of mobile phones but still useful for discrete conversations. Chili sits at the desk on the phone, dealing with yet another crisis. They consider each other a moment until Chili finally checks his watch, a reminder of the tight shooting schedule they are under. Karen, an influential actress in the project, looks caught, doesn't answer right away. Chili lets that sink in a minute, understanding the ramifications of her silence. Leo, the film's financier, sits down in the armchair, stares sadly at the briefcase, knowing it contains documents that could make or break the production. Leo nods. He picks up the briefcase as he rises from the sofa, and Leo gets out of his chair, signaling the end of their discussion. Chili reaches for the door, opens it, and looks back at Leo. As Chili starts for the elevator, he thinks about the complexity of the film business. Chili drives a dark road up into the park, a secluded location often used for secretive industry meetings. Chili pulls in behind a row of trailers, which serve as temporary offices for the film crew. He gets out of the car and heads for the set where Harry, now in full director mode, is looking up at the sky and yelling at someone, likely a crew member about the lighting. He rounds a corner, and we see an explosion of light up ahead as we come upon the filming of a nighttime scene. As he starts back, he sees Leo's scared look just before he slams the door shut, understanding the pressure Leo is under. Leo steps into his doorway. Chili shakes his head, starts back for the elevator, knowing there's more work to be done. Chili stops, turns around, contemplating the path ahead. Chili says nothing, sits down in one of the red leather chairs, a familiar setting for difficult conversations. Bo Catlett smiles at him, doesn't give up the script, knowing the power it holds. Bo watches as Chili picks up a copy of the script, begins flipping through it, searching for insights. Chili flips through the script, sees a name he recognizes as a key character. Karen smiles, decides to wait a moment, appreciating Chili's focus. Chili, lost in the movie, keeps mouthing the dialogue, absorbed in the narrative as if it were part of his life. As Tanya, a character played by the legendary Marlene Dietrich, resumes her slow walk away, Karen sits down at the end of the row, reflecting on her role. People start getting up to leave, the credits rolling. Chili turns to a guy a few seats away from him, someone who looks like a fellow industry insider. The guy gives Chili a look, puts his arm around his date, and quickly starts up the aisle so that Chili can now see Karen sitting there at the end of the row. She gets up, they start up the aisle together, sharing a moment of mutual understanding. As Karen and Chili exit the theater, stand there a moment, they both ponder the next steps in their complicated lives.

They consider each other a moment until Chili finally checks his watch. Karen looks caught does not answer right away. Chili let us that sink in a minute. Leo sits down in the armchair stares sadly at the briefcase. Leo nods. He picks up the briefcase as he rises from the sofa and Leo gets out of his chair. Chili reaches for the door opens it and looks back at Leo. As Chili starts for the elevator Chili drives a dark road up into the park. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. Chili pulls in behind a row of trailers. He gets out of the car and heads for the set where Harry is now looking up at the sky and yelling at someone. He rounds a corner and we see an explosion of light up ahead as we come upon. As he starts back he sees Leo's scared look just before he slams the door shut. Leo steps into his doorway. Chili shakes his head starts back for the elevator. Chili stops turns around. Chili says nothing. sits down in one of the red leather chairs. Bo Catlett smiles at him does not give up the script. Bo watches as Chili picks up a copy of the script begins flipping through it. Chili flips through the script. sees a name. Karen smiles decides to wait a moment. Chili lost in the movie keeps mouthing the dialogue. As TanyaMarlene Dietrich resumes her slow walk away. Karen sits down at the end of the row. People start getting up to leave. Chili turns to a guy a few seats away from him. The guy gives Chili a look puts his arm around his date and quickly starts up the aisle so that Chili can now see Karen sitting there at the end of the row. She gets up. they start up the aisle together. As Karen and Chili exit the theater stand there a moment.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: He reaches for the script. Harry backs away holds the script to his chest. Bo Catlett notices this. Bo Catlett eyes him a beat then pushes out of his chair. Bo Catlett nods gets up. Ronnie sits up straight. Ronnie opens his coat so that Harry can see a gun tucked in his belt. Bo Catlett gives Ronnie a look. Bo Catlett glances once more at Chili then follows Ronnie out the door. Harry stares at the door a moment senses Chili staring at him. Chili looks at Harry. Chili flips through the script. sees a name. Karen smiles decides to wait a moment. Chili lost in the movie keeps mouthing the dialogue. As TanyaMarlene Dietrich resumes her slow walk away. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: She dives for the painting. Larry leaps forward, clutches the painting to his chest. Don Treadwell observes this. Don Treadwell watches her intently, then leaps up from his stool. Don Treadwell winks, stands up. Martha stretches awkwardly. Martha removes her jacket so Larry can spot a knife tucked in her waistband. Don Treadwell flashes Martha a grin. Don Treadwell glimpses once more at Pepper then follows Martha through the window. Larry glares at the window briefly, senses Pepper glaring at him. Pepper gazes at Larry. Pepper shrugs as Larry plops into one of the couches, digs around for his keys. Pepper's truck is parked nearby. Clearly flustered now, massages her temples and hurriedly jogs over to a group of mailboxes. Pepper reclines at the table on the phone. They examine each other briefly until Pepper finally peeks at his calendar. Rachel appears trapped, doesn’t reply immediately. Pepper lets that linger for a second. Gus crouches in the recliner, glances sadly at the suitcase. Gus sighs. She grabs hold of the suitcase as she climbs off the carpet and Gus shuffles out of his recliner. Pepper lunges for the window, swings it open and glances back at Gus. As Pepper heads for the ladder. Pepper navigates a dim path up into the meadow. Pepper parks alongside a line of wagons. He exits the vehicle and strides towards the stage where Larry is currently surveying the clouds and shouting at somebody. He maneuvers around a bend, and we witness a burst of brightness ahead as we stumble upon. As he trots back, he spots Gus’s worried expression just before he slams the window closed. Gus strides into his doorway. Pepper shakes her head, trots back towards the ladder. Pepper halts, pivots around. Pepper remains silent, reclines into one of the green velvet couches. Don Treadwell grins at her, doesn’t relinquish the painting. Don observes as Pepper grabs a version of the painting, starts leafing through it. Pepper leafs through the painting, spots a signature. Rachel grins, opts to pause a second. Pepper, engrossed in the exhibition, keeps silently mouthing the monologues. As Tina/Jane Austen recommences her slow drift away, Rachel perches at the edge of the line. Visitors begin rising to depart. Pepper glances at a man a few places away from them. The man flashes Pepper a glance, wraps his arm around his partner, and swiftly moves up the corridor so that Pepper can now spot Rachel sitting there at the end of the line. She rises, they walk up the corridor together. As Rachel and Pepper vacate the gallery, they pause a moment.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Bo Catlett notices Harry clutching a script, then leaves with Ronnie, who reveals a gun. Chili observes Harry nervously sitting down and going to a row of payphones. Meanwhile, Leo sits sadly with a briefcase. Chili heads out, drives to a film set where Harry is yelling, prompting an explosion of light. Seeing Leo scared, Chili returns to the elevator, turns back, and sits in a chair. Bo smiles but keeps the script while Chili flips through it, mouthing dialogue. Karen watches him, then joins him as people leave the theater. They exit together, pausing momentarily outside.
